name: Accounting (Legacy)
description: The modern field of Accountancy is a serious and honorable profession. Many human beings have spent their lives toiling over the hard science of numbers. Thousands have died so that we may get to the level of understanding that we have today. Thousands have died.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1 or later, Windows 10 Processor: CPU: Intel i5-4590 equivalent or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 970, AMD Radeon R9 290 equivalent or better Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: yes Additional Notes: VIRTUAL REALITY ONLY

reviews.review_text: As a professional accountant, I can safely say that this game is a remarkably accurate representation of my day-to-day job. It's downright eerie how they captured the nuance of the profession. Two thumbs up.
A walking simulator where you have to actually do the walking with your own actual legs. Bloody outrageous.

I love Rick & Morty and this pretty much brings all of that bizarre humor into the VR world. I had quite a few really good laughs watching/participating in this. I expected it to be more of a passive movie type experience but you actually have to do stuff to progress through it. Don't worry though, I figured it out so you should have no problem.  Stuff I liked:     Rick and morty voices and humor     It also had a slight 'Stanley Parable' feel to it at times     It's Free! Don't wait to download it and try it, DO IT! DO IT NOW!   Things I didn't like:     A little more variety in the dialog and this would be great. It's fun to watch, but after you do one time through you probably won't need to run it again.     Some parts are obvious what to do, other parts are not so obvious. I figured it all out anyway, but it could be better.     There's just not enough of it. I want more... I want like a whole series of this type of stuff where you have to figure your way through the virtual worlds.    So yeah, I don't have much bad to say about it, and it's worth the download and time to run it .... Definitely check it out.

This game... err... challenge... uhh... experience, was interesting...  First off, I would rate the game mature for language and themes. Definitely wouldn't want my kids playing this (don't be fooled by the cute, cartoony imagery on the icon). That being said, the game has moments where you think to yourself, 'this might actually be fun'. I would categorize this title as a puzzle game hiding behind a dirty, hybrid facade of Family Guy and South Park. It's entertaining for it's short lifespan and definitely worth the admission price (free, just in case they decide to start charging for it).   Technically, the game was alright. Most of the scenes were fluid with very few bugs and a decent level of interactivity. I believe they do an adequate job of representing the capabilities of VR.  Overall, I would give this title a 5/10, which isn't bad considering what it is; a 30 minute distraction from reality. Play it once: snicker, tremble, yawn, and then throw it away.

Accounting is a VR program that does not understand negative space.  Accounting is a linear procession of simple “find the key” puzzles whose primary impetus is to punish with noise pollution until the player submits.   Accounting is a comedian who’s set is bombing. They can’t read the room. They keep stumbling though the same jokes until the audience feels compelled to leave.

(spoiler-free review. I suggest you play it yourself or you won't experience it properly)  Equal parts Weird, Confusing, and Hilarious! Not sure how to describe the experience, it's very unique for sure. I was laughing my ♥♥♥ off from the first scene. The dialogue is the best part followed closely by the dynamic situations you find yourself in. I really appreciate some of the things they tried here that would only have impact in VR. Scenes 2 & 3 both use immersion and perspective to create a something I haven't felt in games before. Finally, I was pretty hesistant to experience some of the choices the game forces on you but overall it was cool in retrospect.  Who knows what Squanchtendo's next game will be like... but it will be a strange & magical beast guaranteed!
